documents.description: Solvent for Industrial Applications: Due to its ability to dissolve a wide range of non-polar compounds, 99% isopropyl alcohol is extensively used as a solvent in industries such as pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, and electronics. It's particularly useful for cleaning electronic components (such as circuit boards) because it evaporates quickly, leaving no residue.	Cleaning Agent: In addition to its use as a solvent, 99% isopropyl alcohol is a powerful cleaning agent for removing sticky residues, ink stains, or grease from various surfaces. It's also used for cleaning glass and mirrors for a streak-free finish, as well as for preparing surfaces before painting or coating, ensuring that they are free of oils and other contaminants.	Safety-Data-SheetSpecification-Sheet
documents.title: Isopropyl Alcohol ACS

documents.description: Manufacturing of Vinyl Acetate Monomer (VAM): Glacial acetic acid is a key ingredient in the production of VAM, which is a precursor to polyvinyl acetate and polyvinyl alcohol. These polymers are used in adhesives, paints, films, and textiles.Food Industry: In its diluted form, acetic acid is widely known as vinegar, which is used as a condiment and preservative. Glacial acetic acid can be used to adjust acidity in food products and as a food additive for flavoring.Chemical Synthesis and Pharmaceuticals: It serves as a solvent and reagent in the synthesis of various chemicals, including aspirin and other pharmaceuticals. Its properties facilitate the production of fine chemicals and active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs) with high purity.Safety-Data-SheetSpecification-Sheet
documents.title: Glacial Acetic Acid ACS
